question.title: What does `@SuppressWarnings("javadoc")` do? When is it Redundant?
question.body: I have @SuppressWarnings("javadoc") on almost every class. My IDE gives me a warning on virtually all of them: "Redundant suppression". I assume advances in technology have made this annotation obsolete, but would like to understand what this annotation did in the first place. I could not find anything helpful. Apparently it suppresses compiles warnings, but I couldn't find anything on the argument "javadoc". And my code does compile, why would javadoc stand in the way of compiling anyway?
